item.title: Modifying Hugo themes
item.description: Just a starting point for Hugo theme modification.

item.title: GitHub to Netlify
item.description: Check the official documentation for GitHub and Netlify.

item.title: Robots.txt
item.description: Added enableRobotsTXT = true to the config.toml file And: [params.robots] noindex = true Added robots.txt to the static folder with: User-agent: * Disallow: /

item.title: Google Analytics
item.description: Added the following to config.toml to set up Google Analytics: [params.googleTagManager] id = “id…”

item.title: Replit setup
item.description: So I read this link to help me set up Replit to use Hugo. Build and host your company blog on Replit with Nix and Hugo - DEV Community Open `replit.nix` and append `pkgs.hugo`to the `deps` list In the shell, run: hugo new site --force . cd themes && git clone https://github.com/panr/hugo-coder && cd .. Add the following line to the bottom of `config.toml`: theme = 'hugo-coder' Add: run = "hugo server --buildDrafts --buildFuture --bind 0.

item.title: Example: Dual Content Post
item.description: Understanding Hugo: A Personal Journey Link to heading When I first discovered Hugo, I was struggling with the slow build times of my Jekyll blog. Every time I wanted to preview a change, I had to wait several minutes for the site to rebuild. This was frustrating and killed my writing momentum. Why I Chose Hugo Link to heading After researching various static site generators, Hugo stood out for several practical reasons:
